definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Spot ALL the barbecue skewers AND cuffs.
sentences.chinese: 找出所有的烧烤架和手铐。

sentences.english: Jack then has Lauren break his handcuffs with a pair of bolt cutters.
sentences.chinese: 然后，杰克指令萝伦用一把断线钳剪断了他的手铐。

sentences.english: Gates yelled to a crowd outside his house as he was handcuffed.
sentences.chinese: 当他被戴上手铐时，盖茨向房子周围的人群大喊。

sentences.english: When he wakes up he finds that he is locked the handcuffs by the guard, Owen and electric edition disappear suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 贵仁醒来被警卫锁上手铐，欧文及电版不翼而飞。

sentences.english: He was brought into the room (and) handcuffed.
sentences.chinese: 他被带进了屋，手上带着手铐。

sentences.english: I was worried about being handcuffed and led out of the shop in front of my customers.
sentences.chinese: 我害怕戴上手铐在顾客面前被带出餐馆。

sentences.english: A third time he freed himself of his manacles.
"I thought I was going to be led away in handcuffs," she said.
sentences.chinese: “我感觉我会被戴上手铐带走，”她说。

sentences.english: The men used handcuffs and tape to restrain security guards.
sentences.chinese: 男子用手铐和胶带来约束安全卫士。

sentences.english: Doctrine to a fool is as fetters on the feet, and like manacles on the right hand.
sentences.chinese: 纪律为愚昧人，就如脚镣，和右手上的手铐。

sentences.english: Many other defendants were handcuffed but were not wearing prison clothes.
sentences.chinese: 许多别的被告上了手铐，但没穿囚衣。
拍摄时的旁观者也要带上手铐了。

sentences.english: Harry Houdini also was famous for escaping from handcuffs.
sentences.chinese: 哈里胡迪尼也被从手铐逃跑而闻名。

sentences.english: Does viola know the key she had for Law's cuffs might not be real.
sentences.chinese: 维奥拉知道她发现的罗的手铐钥匙可能是假的吗？

sentences.english: We hugged as well as we could with the handcuffs.
sentences.chinese: 我们戴着手铐尽可能地互相拥抱。

definition: to bind a person's upper body, with arms tied behind the back and rope looped around the neck/to truss up
